case_title: COMMISSIONER OF INCOME-TAX vs S.G. TEJA SHAH CHIRANJIT LAL & CO
respondant: S.G. Teja Shah Chiranjit Lal & Co
respondent: S.G. Teja Shah Chiranjit Lal & Co
complaint_summary: The Revenue questioned whether the income of two periods could be clubbed following the death of a partner in a partnership firm.
investigation_summary: The Income-tax Appellate Tribunal referred the matter to the Allahabad High Court for clarification on whether the predecessor firm dissolved upon the death of a partner or continued with a changed constitution.
judgment_summary: The court held that the predecessor firm dissolved upon the death of Shankar Dass, and a new firm was constituted with the remaining partners and a newly inducted partner, Smt. Seelawati. The court ruled that the case fell under Section 188 of the Income Tax Act, 1961, and not Section 187. The income of the two periods could not be clubbed.
Decision_or_verdict: Reference answered in favor of the assessee and against the Revenue.
legal_arguments: Section 188 of the Income Tax Act, 1961, applies where a firm is succeeded by another firm.
Section 187 does not apply as the predecessor firm dissolved upon the death of a partner.

facts.new_firm: Constituted by remaining partners and Smt. Seelawati as a new partner
facts.partnership_deed_clause: No clause preventing dissolution upon death of a partner

legal_provisions.section_187: Change in constitution of the firm
legal_provisions.section_188: Succession of one firm by another firm

key_issues: Whether the predecessor firm dissolved upon the death of a partner.
Applicability of Section 188 versus Section 187 of the Income Tax Act.
key_issue: Whether the income of the two periods could be clubbed following the death of a partner in the firm.

legal_terms.Predecessor Firm: The firm existing before the death of a partner.
legal_terms.Successor Firm: The firm constituted after the dissolution of the predecessor firm.

words_and_phrases.Clubbed Income: Combining income of two periods for tax assessment purposes.

court_decision.predecessor_firm_status: Dissolved upon death of Shankar Dass
court_decision.successor_firm_status: New firm constituted with remaining partners and Smt. Seelawati
court_decision.question_answered: In the affirmative, against the Revenue and in favor of the assessee

summary_vector_notes: The judgment clarifies the dissolution of a partnership firm upon the death of a partner and the subsequent formation of a successor firm under Section 188 of the Income Tax Act, 1961. The court ruled against the Revenue and upheld the Appellate Tribunal's decision.
